intro: Ficus lanyuensis, commonly known as the Lanyu fig, is a rare and endemic species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its unique, broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, often in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a small, green fig that ripens to a yellowish color, attracting various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
